Give Mizâdi's gift to Girhâzi
Continue listening to the conversation between Mizâdi and the other leaders
Give Mizâdi's gift to Rahâzi
Listen to the conversation between Mizâdi and the other leaders.
Give Mizâdi's gift to Amalíbi
'Now that we are all gathered here, and the day has been won, I would have words and express my gratitude to each of you.'
Cheer with Mizâdi!
Listen to the conversation between the leaders
Listen to the conversation between Mizâdi and the other leaders
Listen to Mizâdi speak to the other leaders
Gather pile of gifts Mizâdi brought.
'There is much we have accomplished this day.'
'We are standing here, victorious, because of all of you.'
'I wish I shared your joy in battle.'
Give gifts to each of the leaders.
'I never acquired the taste for combat, it just seems my fate to find it.'
TBD
'Barshud has now been driven off, to where we know not. But his forces are splintered, his fortress taken.'
'If I had to guess, he is likely headed south, back to Ordâkh and the Hûl with his tail between his legs.'
'We accept this horn in the spirit in which it is given. If Hamât ever needs our aid, know that we shall remain at the ready to offer our Dumûri to aid her as well.
'My spies will follow him. He will not escape justice.'
'But his end is for a different day. Today we celebrate, and rejoice.'
'For the first time in my lifetime, Shagâna is truly free!'
'Thank you, Mizâdi. Know that the Dumûri stand ready to join you in battle should you need them as well.'
'Amalíbi, what do you think?'
'You do not want the Crown of Hamât. You do not want to rule over all Shagâna.'
'Which is why you should. My Shâra.'
'It was quite the beast! Our friend here made short work of it, however.'
'For Hamât Renewed!'
'I never begrudge a gift, particularly when it's a freshly forged blade, as Mizâdi is fond of giving.'
'I have brought each of you a gift.'
'That and a good ballad are my two weaknesses.'
'I know it may seem strange, and to tempt fate to bring along gifts before victory has shown her face, but I feel quite the opposite.'
'And a jug of Khôrob! Three weaknesses. And - well I'll stop there.'
'I believe these small gifts help assure victory.'
'My Shâra. Always.'
'Numûru can attest to my superstitious nature, and the small gifts I have tendered him over his time with me.'
'For Hamât Renewed!'
'So I have small gifts for each of you, brought from Iridír.'
'[placeholder], would you be kind enough to gather the gifts, and distribute them to each person?'
'For you, Numûru, a new axe. I know how much you appreciate a freshly sharpened blade.'
'For you, Rahâzi, as you seem to rejoice in combat...'
'A special Subuzûri blade - longer and with a specially balanced hilt.'
'Only our finest Subuzûri use this weapon.'
Finish listening to the conversation between Mizâdi and the other leaders
Finish listening to the conversation between Mizâdi and the other leaders
'For you, Girhâzi, a specially carved horn. This is a symbolic gesture between our peoples.'
Bow out of respect to Mizâdi
'We will come to your aid when you call.'
'Though you may have to send a rider, my ears are not keen enough to hear that horn from across our lands.'
Mizâdi, Girhâzi, Rahâzi, Amalíbi, and Numûru have gathered outside Dun Shûma to discuss their victory and what is next for Shagâna.
'Thank you Girhâzi. Finally for Amalíbi.'
'I have apologized to you, and I know you said that was enough.'
'I still believe there is more distance to cover between us.'
'Please accept this gift. One of my scouts will ride with you.'
'They can be dispatched at any time at your discretion, but they can also ride to me at any time of your choosing...'
'And warn me if you need my aid. No longer will the Khûd stand alone. We will be there to aid you, and quickly.'
'There is still a matter we must discuss.'
'Hamât once ruled all of Shagâna, all under a single banner.'
'I ride for Hamât, and in my blood flows that of Aragín the Queller, uniter of Shagâna.'
'But being with you all, I do not wish to be Shâra of all Shagâna.'
'I would rule with all of you, not over you.'
'Agree with what?'
'Thank you all. You are right, I do not want this.'
'But I accept.'
'May all of Shagâna be free! For Hamât Renewed!'
Finish listening to the conversation between Mizâdi and the other leaders.

Instance: Hamât Renewed
Continue listening to the conversation
Listen to the conversation between Mizâdi and the other leaders
Speak with Mizâdi at Dun Shûma.
'A real Subuzûri blade! This is quite the weapon! I shall not always use it, but when I do, know that I will think of you. My thanks.'
'Yes?'
'Thank you, Mizâdi. I have accepted your apology, and I accept your gift, gratefully.'

'A saddle? Oh I see. Thank you. It has not been easy to come together with everything that has happened these past few weeks, but I thank you for this gift, and accept it in the spirit in which it is offered.'
'Hmm, yes. Yes, I agree.'
'My Shâra.'
'I am grateful. This axe has a fine balance, and look at that blade! The skulls we shall split with her!'
'For Hamât Renewed!'
Ascend the stairs to find the other prisoners
'The fight was over far too soon for me.'
'And I missed the Mûmak entirely! It saddens me.'
'It is beautiful, thank you. Well balanced.'
'My Shâra.'
'For Hamât Renewed!'
Speak with Mizâdi at Dun Shûma
